author: Aisuuuuun-sensei
text:
And now, I am happy, most of them found their sides. Many of them are happy knowing that we are in the same side.

At the end. You are the one who chose this side after all. The challenge is to stand all the way, defending your sides.

Padayon!

author: Aisuuuuun-sensei
text:
During classess in PolGov, Econ, and other social sciences disciplines, my students always ask me,
"Sir, saang side po kayo?"
"Sir, ano pong masasabi ninyo?"

author: Aisuuuuun-sensei

author: Aisuuuuun-sensei
text: Ayun, teachable moments po ito para sa mga history teachers. Time din to reflect about our relevance as teachers of history. Trolls might be teaching history way more passionately than us eh.

author: Aisuuuuun-sensei
text: of Marcos Sr. I cannot grasp why people will vote bongbong, and he tops the survey, may nagawa ba syang remarkable during his years in public office? Or may plataporma ba sya na pinepresent? Di nga umaattend ng debates. Or was it just his surname?

author: Aisuuuuun-sensei
text:
...and interviews straight from Imelda and the Marcoses. They actually happily volunteered the interviews for the docu. 
Kaya watching Kingmaker actually provide our students with what critics are saying and what the Marcoses themselves have to say. Kaya a good material to watch.

author: Aisuuuuun-sensei
text: ...today, diba po. As teachers of history, we ought to present our students these facts and syempre the claims that may counter these facts. Maybe listen to the Marcoses, too, and to their version of what happened. I watched the kingmaker, and much of it were actually soundbites-

author: Aisuuuuun-sensei
text:
...Philippines for two decades pero we end up lagging behind by the end of Marcos rule. Was sending Filipinos abroad as contract workers an evidence of a golden age? Etc. 

Those are just some of the overwhelming facts. We can deny them pero they remain to be hard facts until...

author: Aisuuuuun-sensei
text: ...foreign debt (case in point, lung center, heart center, while health centers in most towns and barangays were lacking if not non existent), clearly the project of bagong lipunan failed, as we had been left behind by other countries. Isnt it a shame na the Marcoses ruled the...

author: Aisuuuuun-sensei
text: As for Martial Law, established and reliable yung facts na nagnakaw ang mga Marcos (courts here and abroad say so, include pa ung bank records), na there were human rights violations (as affirmed by courts, as recounted by victims), na there were prestige projects funded by....

author: Aisuuuuun-sensei
text: Bagamat maraming versions, we have to establish din na there are ways to approach truth, somehow, if not in its fullness. Dyan papasok ang historical method which is akin to scientific method. We deal with sources, evaluate them, and make judgments if they can be made.

author: Aisuuuuun-sensei
text:
Just wanna share what my history instructor have said:

Napakagandang exercise in historical thinking ang marcos dictatorship. 

Students will learn na there might be one past, pero there are many histories. Kaya they have to be critical bago maniwala.

author: Aisuuuuun-sensei
text: From my Apalit High School students during Practice Teaching, to my St. John the Baptist Catholic School - JHS and Holy Angel University - SHS students, Dakal a dakal a salamat kekayu!

author: Aisuuuuun-sensei
text: I am always grateful to my students who don't forget to greet me this day no matter how busy they are. Your minute of greetings feels like a lifetime support. Your simple thoughts made me happy. I miss and love you all.

author: Aisuuuuun-sensei

To all my students who are now in college.
Your teachers are far from your instructors. Always remember that. That is why college is different from high school. And that's why I am always want you to be challenged before for you to be prepared for college.
Hope you are doing well
